intro: Tragacantha mollis, commonly known as the soft tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces a distinctive gum, known as tragacanth, which is exuded from its stems and has been historically used in various industries. Tragacantha mollis typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and commercial purposes.
